Class FileTestUtils

java.lang.Object
  org.owasp.esapi.util.FileTestUtils

public class FileTestUtils
extends Object

Utilities to help with tests that involve files or directories.

Method Detail

createTmpDirectory

public static File createTmpDirectory(File parent,
                                      String prefix,
                                      String suffix)
                               throws IOException
Create a temporary directory.

Parameters:
parent - The parent directory for the temporary directory. If this is null, the system property "java.io.tmpdir" is used.
prefix - The prefix for the directory's name. If this is null, the full class name of this class is used.
suffix - The suffix for the directory's name. If this is null, ".tmp" is used.
Returns:
The newly created temporary directory.
Throws:
IOException - if directory creation fails
SecurityException - if File.mkdir() throws one.

createTmpDirectory

public static File createTmpDirectory(String prefix)
                               throws IOException
Create a temporary directory. This calls createTmpDirectory(File, String, String) with null for parent and suffix.

Parameters:
prefix - The prefix for the directory's name. If this is null, the full class name of this class is used.
Returns:
The newly created temporary directory.
Throws:
IOException - if directory creation fails
SecurityException - if File.mkdir() throws one.

createTmpDirectory

public static File createTmpDirectory(Class cls)
                               throws IOException
Create a temporary directory. This calls createTmpDirectory(File, String, String) with null for parent and suffix.

Parameters:
cls - The class who's name is used for the file prefix.
Returns:
The newly created temporary directory.
Throws:
IOException - if directory creation fails
SecurityException - if File.mkdir() throws one.
NullPointerException - if cls is null.

createTmpDirectory

public static File createTmpDirectory()
                               throws IOException
Create a temporary directory. This calls createTmpDirectory(File, String, String) with null for all arguments.

Returns:
The newly created temporary directory.
Throws:
IOException - if directory creation fails
SecurityException - if File.mkdir() throws one.

createTmpFile

public static File createTmpFile(File parent,
                                 String prefix,
                                 String suffix)
                          throws IOException
Create a temporary file.

Parameters:
parent - The directory to create the file in. If this is not null, File.createTempFile(String,String,File) is used to create the file. Otherwise File.createTempFile(String,String) is.
prefix - The file name's prefix. If this is null, this class name is used. A period is appended to the prefix if one is not present.
suffix - The suffix for the file. If this is null, ".tmp" is used. If the first character is not a period, one is prepended.
Returns:
The canonical File for the temporary file created.
Throws:
IOException - if file creation or canonicalization does.
SecurityException - if file creation or canonicalization does.

createTmpFile

public static File createTmpFile(String prefix)
                          throws IOException
Create a tmporary file. This simply delegates to createTmpFile(null,prefix.null).

Parameters:
prefix - The prefix to pass to createTmpFile(File, String, String)
Throws:
IOException

createTmpFile

public static File createTmpFile(Class cls)
                          throws IOException
Create a tmporary file. This simply delegates to createTmpFile(null,cls.getName().null).

Parameters:
cls - Class who's name will be used for the prefix.
Throws:
NullPointerException - if cls is null.
IOException

createTmpFile

public static File createTmpFile()
                          throws IOException
Create a tmporary file. This simply delegates to createTmpFile(null,null.null).

Throws:
IOException

isChildSubDirectory

public static boolean isChildSubDirectory(File parent,
                                          File child)
                                   throws IOException
Checks that child is a directory and really a child of parent. This verifies that the canonical child is actually a child of parent. This should fail if the child is a symbolic link to another directory and therefore should not be traversed in a recursive traversal of a directory.

Parameters:
parent - The supposed parent of the child
child - The child to check
Returns:
true if child is a directory and a direct decendant of parent.
Throws:
IOException - if File.getCanonicalFile() does
NullPointerException - if either parent or child are null.

delete

public static void delete(File file)
                   throws IOException
Delete a file. Unlinke File.delete(), this throws an exception if deletion fails.

Parameters:
file - The file to delete
Throws:
IOException - if file is not null, exists but delete fails.

deleteRecursively

public static void deleteRecursively(File file)
                              throws IOException
Recursively delete a file. If file is a directory, subdirectories and files are also deleted. Care is taken to not traverse symbolic links in this process. A null file or a file that does not exist is considered to already been deleted.

Parameters:
file - The file or directory to be deleted
Throws:
IOException - if the file, or a descendant, cannot be deleted.
SecurityException - if File.delete() does.

Parameters:
dir - The directory the file should be in. If this is null, System.getProperty("java.io.tmpdir") is used.
